thread.title: National analyst: Referees were 'borderline fixing' Texas-Oklahoma State game
thread.title_full: National analyst: Referees were 'borderline fixing' Texas-Oklahoma State game | Dallas Morning News

author: Nick Castillo
title: National analyst: Referees were 'borderline fixing' Texas-Oklahoma State game
text:
Yahoo Sports' Shaun King said the referees officiating the Oklahoma State-Texas game were 'intentionally trying to prevent the Texas Longhorns from winning a football game.'
The Longhorns were penalized 16 times for 128 yards against the Cowboys. Those penalties hurt Texas' chances against Oklahoma State. None hurt worst than a late-game defensive holding call on defensive tackle Poona Ford, which caused head coach Charlie Strong to get angry with a referee resulting in an unsportsmanlike penalty.
"These were phantom calls, these were bogus calls," King said. "Defensive holding on a guy who got pushed 10 yards down the field? ... This is ridiculous. Something needs to be done. This wasn't incompetence, to me, this was borderline fixing a game."
